Cristy B - Cristy B Comedy Club Skip to content PALM COAST: 180 Cypress Point Pkwy #A110 DAYTONA: 242 Beach St #100 Home Upcoming Shows Book Comedians Cristy B Menu Buy Tickets Now About Cristy B Cristy B: Comedy Queen & Club Boss Cristy B isn’t just a comedian—she’s a force. With 12+ years on stage, her edgy, bold, and unapologetically real humor hits home for singles, couples, and anyone who loves a good laugh. She’s toured with Chris Kattan and opened for Carlos Mencia, Jimmie “JJ” Walker, Orny Adams, Brett Ernst, Vicki Barbolak , and more. Now, she’s leveling up the comedy game as the owner of Cristy B Comedy Club (“The Club”) in Palm Coast , where she books killer talent every weekend. Comedy is her oxygen, and nothing makes her happier than a room full of people laughing. Follow the laughs. Follow Cristy B. I’m originally from Maryville Tennessee I left Tennessee when I was 24 to become a Delta flight attendant from there I moved to Atlanta Georgia where I lived for 12 years before moving here to Flagler Beach Florida I’ve been in Florida for 10 years now. I am Mom first before anything of 3 amazing children. They bring me the greatest joy in my life. I book amazingly talented nationally touring comedians. I love my job and I am happy to work with the venues to help them bring in some revenue. Everyone needs a break from some things in life every now and then and get out and have some fun and laughs. Being in a room full of happy and laughing people is the best part of my job. I have worked with several hundred comedians and have put on a comedy show in more than 30 different rooms. Booking cristybcomedy@yahoo.com Facebook Instagram Tiktok Cristy B Can Bring The Show To You!
Restaurants, clubs, private parties and more! Book Cristy B ©  2025 Cristy B Comedy Club - All Rights Reserved       | Privacy Policy Back To Top

About Us — Comedy Reflects Our World 0 Skip to Content Comedy Reflects Our World About Us About Us Educators Supporters Testimonials Annual Reports 990s Volunteer Accessibility Community Programming Education Comedy Classes For Kids Storyectomy* Door Girlz Bergamot Comedy Fest Tomorrow's Ladies of Late Night Scholarship Submission Form Press & Media Comedy Shows Donate Contact Open Menu Close Menu Comedy Reflects Our World About Us About Us Educators Supporters Testimonials Annual Reports 990s Volunteer Accessibility Community Programming Education Comedy Classes For Kids Storyectomy* Door Girlz Bergamot Comedy Fest Tomorrow's Ladies of Late Night Scholarship Submission Form Press & Media Comedy Shows Donate Contact Open Menu Close Menu Folder: About Us Back About Us Educators Supporters Testimonials Annual Reports 990s Volunteer Accessibility Folder: Community Programming Back Education Comedy Classes For Kids Storyectomy* Door Girlz Bergamot Comedy Fest Tomorrow's Ladies of Late Night Scholarship Submission Form Press & Media Comedy Shows Donate Contact OUR MISSION The CROW was founded on the principle that comedy and storytelling can change the world. In disarming people through laughter, we are able to share different perspectives, stories, and world lenses, ultimately creating a more accepting, understanding society. Through storytelling we create a brighter, richer, and more eclectic cultural landscape by opening audiences up to new voices and ideas. The Crow's focus is not only on providing opportunities to storytellers and comics, but also deliver to audiences the importance of being able to see their humanity reflected in the artist on stage. OUR MISSION The CROW was founded on the principle that comedy and storytelling can change the world. In disarming people through laughter, we are able to share different perspectives, stories, and world lenses, ultimately creating a more accepting, understanding society. Through storytelling we create a brighter, richer, and more eclectic cultural landscape by opening audiences up to new voices and ideas. The Crow's focus is not only on providing opportunities to storytellers and comics, but also deliver to audiences the importance of being able to see their humanity reflected in the artist on stage. Nicole Blaine Executive Producer is the owner and artistic director of The Crow, LA’s newest mission-driven comedy club. With a 20+ year background in producing live comedy shows in Los Angeles and New York, comedy festivals (Bergamot Comedy Fest, Westside Showdown), stand-up specials (HBO), her self-produced comedy special, Life’s A Bit through Comedy Dynamics on Amazon Prime, and her critically acclaimed one-woman show, Pipe Dreams, she is thrilled to bring humor to those who need it most. The culmination of Nicole Blaine’s life’s work is Storyectomy, a mental health initiative she founded to foster healing through storytelling. Blaine hopes to cultivate a community of survivors, thrivers, and caretakers who will find respite and relief in cathartic storytelling. Blaine holds a liberal arts degree in both theater and education from Loyola Marymount University. She has always been passionate about teaching storytelling and comedy on a stage that is inclusive and empowering for all. Everyone deserves the opportunity to find their voice and share their point of view with the world. Because… What if hearing a person’s backstory changes how you move forward? Maybe, just maybe, one person’s story can make the world a better place. Nicole Blaine Executive Producer is the owner and artistic director of The Crow, LA’s newest mission-driven comedy club. With a 20+ year background in producing live comedy shows in Los Angeles and New York, comedy festivals (Bergamot Comedy Fest, Westside Showdown), stand-up specials (HBO), her self-produced comedy special, Life’s A Bit through Comedy Dynamics on Amazon Prime, and her critically acclaimed one-woman show, Pipe Dreams, she is thrilled to bring humor to those who need it most. The culmination of Nicole Blaine’s life’s work is Storyectomy, a mental health initiative she founded to foster healing through storytelling. Blaine hopes to cultivate a community of survivors, thrivers, and caretakers who will find respite and relief in cathartic storytelling. Blaine holds a liberal arts degree in both theater and education from Loyola Marymount University. She has always been passionate about teaching storytelling and comedy on a stage that is inclusive and empowering for all. Everyone deserves the opportunity to find their voice and share their point of view with the world. Because… What if hearing a person’s backstory changes how you move forward? Maybe, just maybe, one person’s story can make the world a better place. Meet the Board Jason Rudolph President | Comedy Reflects our World. Chief Finance and Operations Officer & General Counsel, Equitas Academy Charter Schools. Executive leader, attorney, and policy advocate in a charter management organization. Education: Loyola Marymount University, B.A. Political Science, 2002; Southwestern University School of Law, J.D., 2005. He/Him, 45 | Black, Pacific Islander Monica Avina Granados Treasurer | Comedy Reflects our World. Controller at Greene Broilette & Wheeler, LLP. Monica Avina Granados is the mom of two video-game obsessed boys, the wife of a super hot lesbian, the daughter of Mexican immigrants, and the good friend of the funniest smartest comedy club owner in LA. She keeps her finger on the pulse of all things pop culture, women’s sports, and broadway musicals while also making gourmet meals for her family and managing all the paperwork and appointments and shoe sizes it takes to raise two kids. She only wears black, but has recently incorporated a stripe or two of color in her socks and baseball caps. She is the Chief Vacation Organizer for her friends. She serves as Controller for a prominent law firm in LA. Her claim to fame is that she and her wife were the first gay couple to get married in the city of LA when it became legal in 2008 Education : BA in Accounting. She/Her, 47 | Lgbt | Latina Shane Murphy Goldsmith Shane has worked in nonprofit and government for twenty-seven+ years on justice and equity, including: housing/homelessness, LGBTQ, racial justice, public safety and criminal justice. Education : Kenyon College, BA (1998); Cal State Long Beach, MA She/Her, 47 | lgbt Camilla Chan Benham Partner | Frankfurt Kurnit Klein + Selz PC Attorney | Business and Entertainment Litigation Education : College of William & Mary, BA (2000); London School of Economics, MSc (2001); Georgetown University Law Center, JD (2005) She/Her, 46 | Asian | Chinese Jayme  Mechur Marketing consultant. Brand builder, event expert, website creator, content developer, bringer together of people. Santa Monica native. Education: UC Santa Barbara, BA (2003) She/Her, 42 Erin Einstein Dale Attorney at Johnson, Shapiro, Slewett & Kole, LLP Entertainment transactions and representation Education: UCLA, BA (1995); Loyola Law School, JD (1999) She/Her , 51 Jeff Morrow Jeff has been a teacher or counselor for 29 years. Most recently he’s been the Director of college counseling at Oaks Christian School for the past 22 years. During that time he’s managed to staff of eight counselors, taught English, and serve a term as the president of his professional organization, semi, The western association of college admission counseling. He believes deeply in government advocacy and has the opportunity to advocate for counselors in both Sacramento and Washington DC as well as white papers on policy counselors in California. He’s been a part of theater, his entire life, including 14 years as a company member of the Santa Monica Civic light opera. Sapna Iyer Internal Medicine Hospitalist, Kaiser San Diego Medical Center Sapna Iyer is a physician, stand-up comedian, and Nutella enthusiast based in San Diego ,CA. She has a passion for delivering evidence-based patient care and bringing humanity to an often depersonalized, inequitable health care system. She is, as the kids say, "chronically online," and enjoys arguing about movies/television, trying to improve her conversational Italian, and eating her way through every restaurant in town. Education: University of California San Diego, BS Biochemistry, Minor English Literature 2008; Columbia University, Doris Duke Clinical Research Fellowship, 2011-2012; University of Medical School San Diego, MD, 2013; Kaiser Oakland Medical Center, Internal Medicine Residency, 2013-2016. She/Her, 38 Meet the Board Jason Rudolph President | Comedy Reflects our World. Chief Finance and Operations Officer & General Counsel, Equitas Academy Charter Schools. About Us | Goofs Comedy Club top of page ABOUT US CLASSES MENU HEADLINERS SCHEDULE GET TICKETS Menu Close ABOUT US MENU CLASSES HEADLINERS SHOWS SCHEDULE WHO WE ARE Duck Duck Goofs is an independently owned Comedy Club operating in Somerville, MA We were founded as Duck Duck Goofs in 2022, and became Goofs Comedy Club in 2024. We are an independent, locally owned, grassroots comedy club that started by slinging $4 cans out of a cooler in the basement of a community center, and we've grown into a full service venue.​ We're community focused, and believe that from the top to the bottom, every single part of the comedy experience should be given the utmost respect. We take the silly seriously. From our food menu crafted with love by David Wade of Wade BBQ which includes gluten-free and vegan options to our full bar with drinks beginning at $4, we strive for excellence accessibility. We can't wait to welcome you into our home and share our space with you. We love it, and we know you will, too.​ Signed, Ryan, Isabel, and the whole Goofs Crew. MEET THE TEAM Ryan Howe Founder & Creative Director Isabel Thurston Director of Community Engagement Michaelann Ferro Director of Marketing and PR Chloe Borsody House Musician Sena Spinella Hospitality Manager Jocelyn Bailey Team Member Hannah Ladner Team Member DUCK DUCK GOOFS Location 432 McGrath Highway Somerville MA 02143 Contact info@goofscomedy.com (617) 718-7200 Follow © 2025 Duck Duck Goofs LLC Privacy Policy ABOUT US CLASSES MENU HEADLINERS SCHEDULE bottom of page

History - London What’s on Access History The Comedians Gift Vouchers Tickets & Exchanges Food and Drink Account London Manchester Next show Calendar Next show Fri 12 Sep Calendar Pick a date Back to calendar What’s on Food and Drink Gift Vouchers Next show Calendar More History Access Hires History In the beginning..... In May 1979, Don Ward, (Founder, CEO and Executive Producer) opened The Comedy Store in the old Gargoyle Night Club in Dean Street, Soho.   He had been inspired by a trip the previous year to see the new comedy clubs in New York and L.A.  They were producing observational comedy and poking fun at the political scene and the Establishment.  This was so refreshing and stimulating, his aim and dream was to re-create the same in London.  As an ex-comedian and now a producer/owner he wanted to present something different in his venue and a complete evening of ‘alternative’ comedy seemed ideal. The running order from The Store's opening night! Stars Wanted The Plan was to keep the night club running as it was, Monday thru’ Friday and switch to comedy on Saturday.  His initial problem (and there would be many) was where the ‘new’ comedians were coming from?  So adverts were placed in various publications: The Stage, Evening Standard, Evening News, Jewish Chronicle, Grocer’s Gazette, Builders Weekly, Punch and University magazines,  saying -  “Are you trapped in a boring 9 to 5 job when you are a very funny person who wants to become a comedy star”…………..” If your answer is ‘yes’ to that question,  then contact us - The Comedy Store in Soho and become part of our Comedy Revolution - if you have the talent, we will help you to become a Comedy Star.”  Auditions were held and a 150 people showed up! (YES, 150 people).  The first person in the queue was Alexei Sayle, who presented as angry, at odds with everything of authority (if it didn’t make sense) and wonderfully against Maggie Thatcher & Co.  He became the host for the shows for the first three years! Beat The Gong There were so many to audition, Don made the auditions the show, putting on 30 comics to perform 5 minutes each, with a Gong to tell them when it was time to get off.  As there was a strip club on the floor above (Don owned that too!) finishing at 11pm, the comedy started at the bewitching hour of midnight!  In the show was French and Saunders, Mayall and Edmundson, Peter Richardson and Nigel Planer, Keith Allen, Andy de la Tour, with Alexei hosting.  With perhaps 20 others, the show quite often would go on to 4am. My Mother-In-Law.... In the new politically aware environment of the early 80’s, comics with racist, sexist and out-dated jokes were often gonged off quickly making room for performers of the new “alternative” genre,  whose material was considered fresher and more innovative.  The above-mentioned names ticked these boxes and Clive Anderson, Robin Williams, Paul Merton and Ben Elton were soon added to that august list.  These were crazy, amazing formative years and The Comedy Store, smack bang in the middle of decadent Soho reigned supreme, as there was nothing like it in the whole of the UK. "The store has always been one of my favourite clubs in the world, stepping out on that stage still gives me goose bumps...."

- Jack Whitehall Jack Whitehall A New Home At the end of 1982, the lease of the club expired, the landlord offered Don the freehold of the whole building (69/70 Dean St) for the princely sum of £300K!!!!  As he couldn’t find that kind of money (the bank manager said to Don - “…. how can the bank advance you that level of money on a business that just tells jokes?”  The irony is that The Comedy Store became in a few years, a phenomenal success and spawned an industry that stretches everywhere in the UK.  So here he was with a name and business and no home, frustrating to say the least.  We all need a bit of luck in life and Don’s piece of luck arrived at the expense of someone else’s bad luck!  The Subway Night Club, 28 Leicester Square lost its licence owing to various misdemeanours happening in their club late at night, and though an Appeal was made, it took a long time to go to Court, so Don took over the ground floor and presented comedy shows on a Saturday night.  Eventually the Subway Club closed and Don took a chance and applied to Westminster Council for a licence to carry on the business of ‘stand up’ comedy ONLY and the Justices said YES. (Luck).  If the Dean Street Comedy Store hosted the ‘creative years’ - the Leicester Square premises hosted the ‘formative years’.   The stand-up shows started to run on Thursday, Friday and Saturday each week. The Comedy Store Players In October 1985, a young Canadian actor/comic approached Don with an idea for an improvisation show with a cast of six actors and actresses with the idea of taking suggestions from the audience and making a comedy show from those suggestions.  His name was Mike Myers (yes that one, who was later to become a Hollywood star).  The show was a success and became a weekly Sunday night show and later on a weekly Wednesday show.  Paul Merton, Josie Lawrence, Neil Mullarkey, Richard Vranch, Lee Simpson, Jim Sweeney, Dave Cohen, Kit Hollerbach were the nucleus of the original team and some of them are still performing at The Store 35 years later. The Cutting Edge Don and John Connor [Comedy Editor of the (now defunct) weekly listings mag City Limits] were having a drink at a comedy Charity gig in the Hackney Empire one Bank Holiday Monday evening.  John voiced an idea for a topical  show with comedians taking suggestions from the audience. With Alexei Sayle, satire had been a major feature of the original Store - John wanted to build a whole show around it.  When 'The Cutting Edge’ (later to be re-titled ‘The Edge’)  launched in the summer of 1990 there was no show in the country where stand ups commented on the news! It beat TV's 'Have I Got News For You' by some six months.  This would be a joint production between John and The Store, so was born,  a weekly Tuesday night show which is still running 30 years later! Over 30 years The Edge alumni included Bill Bailey, Phil Jupitus, Jo Brand, Andy Parsons, Lee Hurst, Mark Thomas, Eddie Izzard, Linda Smith, Ed Byrne, Marcus Brigstocke and Jimmy Carr. The New Rock & Roll During this period at the Leicester Square venue, lots of American comedians were beginning to show up in the UK as some tv channels were using them as guests on their shows.  Robin Williams, Will Durst, Greg Proops, Ruby Wax, Emo Phillips, Dennis Leary, Bill Hicks were all making their way to The Store to ‘try out’ their material, resulting in some great highs - and some very low lows!  Also, new British comedians were emerging such as Arthur Smith, Julian Clary, Harry Enfield, Rob Newman, David Baddiel, Jack Dee, Mark Lamar, Eddie Izzard, Tony Slatterley, Steve Coogan, Jo Brand, Lee Evans, Sean Hughes, Frank Skinner and Lee Hurst. One Card..... So then the only night of the week left free was Monday.  Don remembered the early days when anybody could phone in and get a chance to perform on The Store’s stage and realised that opportunity was now no longer available.  In the early days, we used a gong to tell the auditioning comedian that his/her time was up, so the gong was brought back for an open mic style show and  re-named ‘The ***’king Gong Show (from what the would-be comedians called the Gong when they were gonged off!) – now abbreviated to The King Gong show – or the Gong show - held on the last Monday of every month.  So those days of giving anybody a chance are back, but now applicants need to email, not ring in. Need A Bigger Boat..... The other three Mondays of each month are used for Registered Charities’ shows or Podcast, Radio, TV recordings.  So there you are, a show every night at 7.30 and later shows at 11pm on Friday and Saturday.  Nine shows a week! -  the only comedy venue in the UK that is open virtually every day.  As with the Dean Street (100 seated), Leicester Square (215 seated), most nights were sold out and customers were being turned away!  So, we had to move to a bigger place.  But we had to be in the W1/SW1 area.... but where were we going to find somewhere that held 400? Going Underground..... The hunt for basement premises (ground floors are too expensive) commenced early in 1992.  In the early 90’s the UK was coming out of a recession and Don had learnt that opportunities to expand only happen during and just after a recession.  This is where ‘lady luck’ came to his aid as Haymarket House (a block of offices on the corner of Coventry Street and Oxendon Street) had empty restaurant premises at ground floor and basement.  They had been empty for a couple of years and he found out that Whitbreads Brewery were going to take both floors and open a TGI Friday restaurant on the ground floor but they didn’t want the basement. Version 3.0 The basement was over 6,000 sq. ft. (perfect size for seating 400) a deal was struck for a 25 year lease and we opened early 1993.  We closed the Leicester Square premises on the Sunday with the Comedy Store Players, the very last performer was Paul Merton, many a tear was shed as we said goodbye to The Comedy Store Mark II, but hey! - we were moving 150 metres SW to a new and bigger home. And We're Back! The next night we mounted a Grand Charity gig and the first performer on was Paul Merton! - supported by the likes of Jack Dee, Eddie Izzard and a host of other performers previously mentioned.  We have been there ever since entertaining over 3,000 people a week from every English-speaking part of the world and now on some Saturday and Sunday afternoons, we host French, Romanian, Danish, Lithuanian and Belgian comedians working in their languages of course!  Comedy is truly International The Northern Powerhouse We’d been told that people travel over 100/150 miles to see a show at The Comedy Store, so Don decided to open one in Manchester.  The search for premises started in 1998 and the following year he found the perfect place - Deansgate Locks, alongside the canal and very close to where the famous music club The Hacienda used to be.  The auditorium seats 500 and an adjacent bar holds 400, plus a canal side restaurant/performance space for 100.  It will blow your mind when you visit it!  Also this year, Manchester will have its 20th Anniversary Gala Show on Monday, 14th September.  Do yourself a favour and buy a ticket. 40 Years Young In 2019 The Comedy Store celebrated its 40th Birthday with a star-studded Gala show, raising money for Teenage Cancer Trust. The line-up was a who's-who of UK comedy with acts such as Michael McIntyre, John Bishop, Jack Dee, Paul Merton, Omid Djalili, Dara Ó Briain and Alexei Sayle who all returned to celebrate this milestone in the club's history. The Store continues to be a hotbed of comic talent where you can see the stars of today and tomorrow perform. As well as established circuit acts, we also give open spots to up-and-coming acts and help them develop their skills. So there you have it, London or Manchester - it’s your choice as long as you want to see the Best, the Original and Newest Comedians On The Planet, then it's The Comedy Store for you. “Be Lucky".......... #thecomedystoreldn Let’s keep in touch 020 7024 2060 1a Oxendon Street, London, SW1Y 4EE Contact Access Hires Tickets & Exchanges History What’s on Privacy policy Copyright © The Comedy Store Ltd | The Comedy Store logo is a EU registered trademark of The Comedy Store Ltd. Local Comic Cristy B Brings Funny to Flagler with Grand Opening of Her First Club in Palm Coast News Bunnell Flagler Beach Palm Coast FCSO Finance Health Junior Editor Letters to the Editor #UnbeelievablyPositive Politics Schools Weather Business Community Dining Events Features Local Comic Cristy B Brings Funny to Flagler with Grand Opening of Her First Club in Palm Coast by Krys DeWind | Apr 4, 2024 | Community , Features , Palm Coast | 0 comments Comedian Cristy B, owner of Cristy B Comedy, opened her very first comedy club today in Palm Coast. The comedy club formerly known as Madcaps Comedy Club, in City Market Place, is now under the new ownership of Cristy B, with shows every Friday and Saturday. Not only does the club offer two sets of shows two days a week, but Cristy plans to host comedy classes and multiple open mic night opportunities. Booking the club for events is also on the horizon for the new Cristy B Comedy Club. Cristy B’s grand opening brought out a large crowd of supporters, including her children and both of her sisters. When asked how she felt about the ribbon cutting and grand opening she told us, “Words can’t really describe, I’m just overwhelmed, joy, I’m just the happiest I’ve ever been. But I’m scared too; I’m not gonna lie, it’s scary. But I see the turnout and I think I’m gonna do alright.” Post Views: 4,041 Submit a Comment Cancel reply Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked * Comment * Name * Email * Website Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment.
